website_summaries.verdict: If you're short on kitchen space, the unique lid flips so unit can slide easily under the counter. If that wasn't convenient enough, the blades and bowl are dishwasher-safe.
pros: Specially designed lid flips for compact storage
Generously sized feed tube can accommodate an entire block of cheese
Dishwasher-safe chopping blade, disc, bowl, and lid
cons: Blender runs loudly, and the lid tab breaks relatively easily

customer_reviews.title: It is very easy to clean - not a lot of small places ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this processor over 4 years ago and it is still going strong. It is very easy to clean - not a lot of small places for food to lodge, in contrast to my last one.. I like the compactness of it. Only complaint is that it is very noisy.
customer_reviews.author: dee

customer_reviews.title: My all time favorite FP.
customer_reviews.text: It has cord storage and with the top part on upside down it stores neatly in minimal space. It works very well and most importantly, it cleans very easily! Because of those things I use this for tasks I used to stick with knife and cutting board for to avoid the mess. This is my favorite food processor ever!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Convenient processor
customer_reviews.text: Great processor, I've used it to make hummus and veggie burgers so far, have got lots of plans for it. Love how the lid allows for streamlined storage, it's easy to clean and simple to use. I've read the other reviews and noted that on occasion it does smell hot so I shall use it with respect and not over work it in case the motor burns out.
customer_reviews.author: Janette Bowler

customer_reviews.title: Great unit, powerful and reliable.
customer_reviews.text: It really works well for everything we've used it for: cheese, pepperoni, salads, cucumbers, etc. Forget all the picky complaints in the reviews. When have you NOT had a small piece of food leftover at the end? As long as you treat this unit with respect, and don't try to run a restaurant with it, you should be fine. I might get a larger more heavy duty unit for a restaurant or large family. But for the two of us, this is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Hermit58Top Contributor: Watches

customer_reviews.title: I love the food processor
customer_reviews.text: I have only had this item 18 days and it gets really hot and wont grade the cheese properly. It needs more power. I'm returning the item.
customer_reviews.author: joe Taylor

customer_reviews.title: better than cuisinart - wish I'd gotten this ages ago!
customer_reviews.text: I always thought Cuisinart was considered the best of food processors. When the bowl on mine broke and it was going to cost almost as much as a new machine to replace, I started looking around. This is half the price, more powerful, and the slicing blade gets far more of the food into the bowl. It's also easier to clean. Amazing!
customer_reviews.author: horatio s.

customer_reviews.title: The top lid with the tab to activate the motor ...
customer_reviews.text: The top lid with the tab to activate the motor cracked the first time used. Ordered a replacement lid from Hamilton Beach for an addition 12 bucks and it didn't fit. Awful machine. Never again.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: it’s impossible to open and close this thing.
customer_reviews.text: I was never able to figure out how to open and close this blender. I tried and I tried and then the lid got stuck and I haven’t been able to get it off. I had such a high hopes since everyone else seemed to really like it. If anyone has experience in opening and closing it please let me know!
customer_reviews.author: Leen Rifai

customer_reviews.title: Great investment for heavy duty use
customer_reviews.text: Amazed at the quality and customer support! This machine is well worth the money because it is much better to invest in a sturdy machine than waste time with regularly replacing cheap machines. We received a replacement bowl in no time at all and at no extra cost, while we are still waiting for a cheap competitor brand to snail mail us (and paid for shipping) a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Gabbie

customer_reviews.title: Great food processor for the price
customer_reviews.text: I've had this food processor for a year now. Its easy to operate, dishwasher safe, and I do like it. Most of the time a knife is faster but I do like doing onions in bulk for the freezer (burn a candle and wear glasses lol). I use this mostly for homemade salsa which my family loves. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: BookLover

customer_reviews.title: Smooth
customer_reviews.text: We have used this product less than a dozen times, so this review is early. However, it works very well and is extraordinarily quiet and smooth running. I would rate its value high. The turn-upside-down top to reduce its profile for storing is nice, but because the slicing disk is on top it's not particularly attractive when set that way. Therefore, it doesn't lend itself as a counter appliance (unless you want to leave the tall plastic lid on top.
customer_reviews.author: J Walter

customer_reviews.title: Great processor for the price
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure there are better ones out there, but this is great for moderate usage. The lids are tricky to get lined up to lock it down, which is annoying, but not fatally. For most homes, I'd say this is great. Heck you could buy 3 or 4 of these compared to some food processors out there. If you fancy yourself a chef and use a food processor daily, you may want to step up to something nicer.
customer_reviews.author: Alan M.

customer_reviews.title: So far, it's great!
customer_reviews.text: I love this food processor. I gave up on Cuisinart after buying two. Both ended up having serious problems after only a couple of uses (e.g. the top and/or certain attachments didn't fit). They were also clunky and the on/off/pulse buttons were much more awkward than this one, which is much more compact and easy to use. It's also a whole lot less expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Knickers62

customer_reviews.title: Got this for Christmas and finally got around to trying ...
customer_reviews.text: Got this for Christmas and finally got around to trying to use it. When I opened the box, the top plastic part was completely broken. I'm not surprised because there is literally no protection in the box. Return window has closed so I guess I'll be throwing it away
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great and easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: our 10 yr old Hamilton Beach Food Processor, started acting up, so i i ordered this one and man does it chop up the pickles the old one would always miss a few big chucks but the new one chopped them all up real quick when i made some tuna salad works great
customer_reviews.author: david a streling

customer_reviews.title: Love, love
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love this food processor. My husband and I own a small BBQ restaurant and brought ours from home. We have since purchased another to use when we do caterings and cook-offs. This product is durable and works great! The blades are still sharp even after using all day, 6 days a week for more than a year and a half to do everything from making hot sauce to chopping brisket. Before we opened the restaurant this was a staple in home use. It's easy to clean and the suction cups on bottom are handy for keeping it in place when in use.
customer_reviews.author: C Mae

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy
customer_reviews.text: The on/off button broke on the first time of use !! Never used it. Dont buy
customer_reviews.author: omer ronen

customer_reviews.title: A little disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I had a kitchenaid 7 cup food processor that I loved, but it met its demise after a switch broke. I chose this replacement after reading reviews here and at Bed Bath & Beyond. I've used it once with a shredder blade and I was disappointed in the shredding/grating I attempted. It left large chunks of food untouched and pieces between the food pusher and the blade didn't get grated. I'll continue to use it, but I'm not over the moon for this processor.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cuts work in half
customer_reviews.text: Product is very easy to clean WITHOUT the "hard to reach" crevices where food becomes trapped. Dishwasher safe (used top rack for the parts). Have used multiple times now without any problems.
customer_reviews.author: Ownedbyadachshund

customer_reviews.title: Best food processor I tried
customer_reviews.text: We're vegan and gluten free, on top of all that we don't eat any processed and manufactured food, no do we eat out. So, yes, good kitchen equipment is of essence. I went through many food processors manufacturer big names, but, this one is the very best I ever tried. Even almond butter takes 2-3 minutes to make, as with kitchen aid, Oster, kitchenmaid, or whatever the fancy names are, it took almost an hour. Yes, it is loud, but, for very short processing times. It's worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Yael Shany

customer_reviews.title: Received broken and defective
customer_reviews.text: My processor came broken Plastic to crack and prices broke off Not able to turn On
customer_reviews.author: Firyil Smith

customer_reviews.title: It does the job.
customer_reviews.text: I waited until I had actually used this appliance. OMG........it is wonderful!! I've owned food processors for many years and most of them fail in short order. Some are just too complicated. All I wanted was a simple machine that would slice and shred. This one does it in spades! YIPPEE for Hamilton Beach and it is very powerful.
customer_reviews.author: QuilterSammy

customer_reviews.title: Simple, clean, stores well.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a 'starter' because the price is relatively cheap and reviews are mostly positive. Since then, I've made humus and falafel twice a week, and for that, this processor gets 5 out of 5. Blitzes well to get things going. Chops herbs evenly, Chickpeas are no match. . . humus turns out nearly blender smooth. The bowl, lid, and blade clean easily with a brush, and I hardly even have to wipe the motor unit as nothing leaks or flies out; if there's a mess, I made it. So light and compact, I store it in a lower cabinet and pull it out when I need it without ever thinking about its weight.
customer_reviews.author: JL

customer_reviews.title: TOO LOUD!
customer_reviews.text: I am returning this for a few reasons. First, it is louder than my high powered blender. I can't imagine subjecting my family to this noise on a daily basis. Secondly, I hate the suction cups on the bottom. Makes it hard to slide around the counter into the position I want. It was really cheap and probably does its job well but I think I will spend $10 more to have quiet and mobility.
customer_reviews.author: A. Colacito

customer_reviews.title: A smaller one would have been a better buy for me
customer_reviews.text: It is amazing how quickly it cuts cabbage and carrots for slaw. I'm sure it will be very helpful for cutting vegetables for soup. Perhaps a smaller one would be more useful to me. I haven't had the unit very long so have not tried pie crust but that was one of the reasons I purchased a larger unit.
customer_reviews.author: Lois Ready

customer_reviews.title: More powerful than I expected
customer_reviews.text: Ground up chicken breasts for chicken meatballs without issue. Only reason for 4 stars are the rubber suction cup feet on the base. I set the food processor out on a butcher block island and the rubber feet left permanent marks on the island. Be careful where you set it.
customer_reviews.author: veshay

customer_reviews.title: Never worked
customer_reviews.text: I bought this blender and just now pulled it out to use it (4 months after purchase) but didn't even work. And just notified it's out of return period. What a waste.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffers

customer_reviews.title: I hate chunks in my food
customer_reviews.text: It works. Its inexpensive. I hate chunks in my food, but like the flavor. Yes, I'm an adult fussy eater. I love the taste of onions, tomato, etc., but near gag if I stumble across a chunk of it sauce, chili, etc. This smooths all the chunks out, leaving the flavor. It makes life good. My only knock, that other may love, the suction cup feet. Holds the machine solid. To me, too grippy. It anchors to my granite counter. Moving it, for better or worse, takes an act of Congress.
customer_reviews.author: J. Mansuy

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommended!
customer_reviews.text: So happy to have found a replacement for my 20 year old food processor. This is actually better, it inverts for storage, the middle stem is attached - one less thing to lose or have to wash. Powerful and stays put on the counter. We bought a few other new models and took them right back! This is a quality product especially for the price. A little cheese gets stuck under the rim after shredding, but they all do that.
customer_reviews.author: PatriciaD2284

customer_reviews.title: Good machine.
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Have used it several times now. Grated cabbage , carrots. Kale didn’t work well. Got stuck in blades. Not the machine’s fault. Just the kind of food it was. Works well.
customer_reviews.author: Sing a joyful noise.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, quiet, well built.
customer_reviews.text: I use my food processor regularly. I've gone thru 2 cuissanarts. The last one I owned had a cracked bowl & lid and to replace these plastic items would have cost almost as much as a new cuisanart. I saw this Hamilton Beach food processor and read the reviews. The cost was less than half of a new cuissanart so I took a chance and purchased it. Boy am I glad that I did. It is a gem and works like a charm, slices and dices in seconds, is quiet, and has suction cups on the bottom so it doesn't move. Great product!!
customer_reviews.author: Linda Dale

customer_reviews.title: Good idea, not practical
customer_reviews.text: I like that this unit is more compact by flipping the lid upside down. I started out using this product for mixing pie crust dough but it didn’t come together like my old Hamilton model. When I was finished using it, I was taking it apart to clean and noticed an amount of leftover ingredients on the base unit, under the bowl and on the motor shaft. I can’t imagine the amount of liquid would be on those parts if I were trying to prepare a salsa or a wet dish.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I chop beans, onions,cabbage. Slicing and shredding i don't use much. It does not work great for slice carrots though. you have to get used to fixing the food processor. Initially i found hard then i got used to it now. Be careful in fixing it as it might take some time to adjust and start pulsing our products.It is big though. You can finish your chopping and keep it on the side if you are running out of space in kitchen. note:be careful with Blades. Blades are very sharp . when taking out the blade and cleaning the blade got my Ring finger cut twice. VERY CAREFUL WITH THE BLADES. as blades are very sharp.
customer_reviews.author: Vignesh Krishnan

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the best food processor I have ever owned! And for the money, its incredible. Don't be fooled by high-priced jazzed up stuff that is large and not intuitive!
customer_reviews.author: am

customer_reviews.title: We use this product in a classroom weekly
customer_reviews.text: We cook every week in the classroom as a teaching experience. It is a safe product to allow children to drop veggies into without fear of hurting little hands and fingers. It mushes, mashes, chops and purees.
customer_reviews.author: Mae Best

customer_reviews.title: Very powerful
customer_reviews.text: This thing is very powerful! I made home Madeleine Peanut Butter in four minutes and it was good. I’ve been wanting one for a while and I’m glad I bought this one. I’m excited to see what new recipes I’ll be making.
customer_reviews.author: Yesi Avila

customer_reviews.title: it's awesome. Compact to store (everything fits inside) and easy ...
customer_reviews.text: A BIG, powerful machine. If you want to move a lot of product fast, this is it. Blades are very sharp, so be careful. Haven't a clue how it will hold up with daily, professional use, but for once or twice a week at home, it's awesome. Compact to store (everything fits inside) and easy to clean, especially in the dishwasher. This is exactly what I was looking for and thanks for all of the reviews that steered me to it.
customer_reviews.author: w ripley

customer_reviews.title: This is a great little machine!
customer_reviews.text: After losing gawd only knows how many hours researching and debating what brand and what sized food processor to replace our old kitchen aid, we opted for this gem. And I love it! Perfect size (a little bigger than our last one), love that the blade sits high enough you don't overflow/spill all the time (and that it is black, doesn't take on the color of what you are mixing!) and, so far, works like a charm. We've only had it a few months, so I'll follow up if we run into any issues down the road. The only thing I don't love are the suction cup feet, but hey, I can live with that - safety first! ;-)
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: only shreds
customer_reviews.text: Chops everything into very small shreds, no slicing as slices of meat or wedges of cabbage, just small scraps.
customer_reviews.author: knitnweed

customer_reviews.title: Product finish
customer_reviews.text: This product is Dishwasher safe however when the bowl, etc was washed in dishwasher it came out dull. Called the company and was told this happens. Very disappointed since last one I had for over 5 years was still as shiny when it stopped working as when I purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: Pat Wildes

customer_reviews.title: Fragile
customer_reviews.text: My top Was cracked I wrote the manner factor and still haven't heard anything back
customer_reviews.author: Rochele Thompkins

customer_reviews.title: Works well!
customer_reviews.text: I have never used a food processor before and really like this one. So far, I have only used it to make sorbet. It works very well for that and, therefore, have many batches of sorbet!
customer_reviews.author: The Family

customer_reviews.title: Like my processor
customer_reviews.text: Used this yesterday to shred cheese for tacos. It did nicely; the only thing I would do different is either pulse what I shred so that it's not crumbly or so it in smaller batches. Otherwise, this works great!
customer_reviews.author: Alaina Williams

customer_reviews.title: I'm satified with the performance.  Slices veggies a treat.
customer_reviews.text: Adjustable slices would be nice, larger feed tube would be good. Makes preparation a lot quicker. I like the machine great value for the money
customer_reviews.author: J. Harris

customer_reviews.title: So loud
customer_reviews.text: Works great, but it's not possible for it to be louder. It's unbelievable how loud this is.
customer_reviews.author: smcfarla

customer_reviews.title: Makes Canning a breeze
customer_reviews.text: I love this Food Processor. It's simple to use, clean, and for the amount of hand cutting it saves me, I couldn't be happier with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: inspectorrick

customer_reviews.title: Keto friendly! Great chopper
customer_reviews.text: Great food processor. It’s powerful and easy to use. It didn’t come with a manual, but one wasn’t needed. I should have purchased this years ago when comparing to the smaller one I have. Today I chopped Celery, carrots and mushrooms using it.
customer_reviews.author: E Singh

customer_reviews.title: Impressed
customer_reviews.text: I returned a Cuisinart food processor as it was really bad at all sorts of things and tried this one due to the price. Really really surprised. Works great and i use it alot
customer_reviews.author: Susan S.

customer_reviews.title: Must have kitchen gadget
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for the home cook! Easy to use, clean, and store.
customer_reviews.author: JLCameron513

customer_reviews.title: it’s Pretty Loud
customer_reviews.text: It’s so loud and keep smelling electoral overheating. I’ve used several times now. It does have good power and easy to clean, but not sure noise is worth it. Verdict still out and will keep my return end date in mind. I’m terrible at returning things, so I’ll like use till I am able to upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Schmitt

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good processor, but watch out!
customer_reviews.text: Great item, especially at this price point. My only complaints are that it is super loud (annoying) and that the blade does not lock in to the bottom of the main bowl (dangerous -- yikes!). Still a nice item, but if I had known the blades would fall out of the bowl when emptying out the processed contents, I would have been more careful...and avoided a pretty bad cut on my finger :(
customer_reviews.author: Cleveland Mom

customer_reviews.title: So far so good with this machine
customer_reviews.text: The machine is pretty much what it's purported to be. Makes a great malt, though there is no pour spout which makes removing the liquid a little messy. This machine doesn't have a very high rpm compared to my old cheapy and therefore has a harder time with grinding things like seeds, bread crumbs etc. I'd still recommend because it performs very well at the middle of the road where it's priced. It's light to carry around has convenient suction cups to anchor it to the counter and stores easily. Some have complained that the motors go to heaven rather quickly so if this occurs I'll do a follow up.
customer_reviews.author: R. Busch

customer_reviews.title: Nice size. Love the suction cups that keep the ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice size. Love the suction cups that keep the base secure on the counter top. Simple and easy to use, On/Off and Pulse modes. Easy to rise and clean. Allows for easy blending. I've made a variety of things from chimichurri sauce to biscuit dough, it works great.
customer_reviews.author: tcille

customer_reviews.title: Definitely not a grind to use this
customer_reviews.text: My parent's old food processor kinda died so I volunteered to get them a new one. It came to the house very quickly (ahead of schedule) and my mom proceeded to chop a whole bunch of nuts and she fell in love with the ease of use as well as cleaning and storing. (their old unit was a 4-dimensional puzzle to pack up for storage) It also looks very nice In other words, my mom loves this and it makes her happy. If she's happy then that's all I need to know. Get this unit
customer_reviews.author: Faemeister

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I’m really enjoying this. It chops onions quick and effortlessly and grates cheese fast. It also doesn’t take much room. Glad I got it!
customer_reviews.author: Pat Gagnon

customer_reviews.title: It chops stuff up. It slices stuff too.
customer_reviews.text: I just wanted to do the stars but they forced me to write something so I'm telling you that it chop stuff up and it slices stuff and shredded stuff too. Work fine quick delivery easy cleaning and storage only used it once so far for slicing and shredding to make a salad.
customer_reviews.author: sputinc

customer_reviews.title: I just got this.  It is my first one.
customer_reviews.text: I just got this food processor and this is my first one. So far I just love it! Shreds cheese like no problem in seconds. It pulverized graham crackers in seconds too. Slicing worked fine but you have to hold things correctly to get the size and shape you want. Plus the feeder tube is not big enough to put like a whole cucumber (diameter) in. I sliced the cucumber in half and then it fit. But I bought this for shredding and pulverizing not so much for slicing. For the price and the size and for what I wanted this is awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy of Use
customer_reviews.text: Works Like A Dream, gave it a good workout last summer when I harvested Tomatoes, Perfect for canning Tomato Sauce and Tomato Salsa!
customer_reviews.author: Irish One

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing!
customer_reviews.text: This was a great purchase! I especially love the slicing and shredding feature. It makes beautiful, thin, uniform slices and I use the shedder mostly for carrots. Works great and shreds/slicing very quickly!
customer_reviews.author: Johanna Epley

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: So far so good!! I even made cheese straws a couple of days ago. I was afraid to let it run too much so I just pulsed it until the batter came together.
customer_reviews.author: AlexandraBenn

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I like everything about this except for the clear plastic piece on the lid that is required to allow it to operate. It is a safety. Problem is it arrived broken when we got it. I was able to jerry rig it and override the safety. Wish they would have made the lid metal so it wouldn't break.
customer_reviews.author: kodiakcowboy

customer_reviews.title: this is a great machine
customer_reviews.text: My little cuisinart died so after reading lots of reviews I settled on this. I have not been disappointed. It's got a lot of power but it's not noisy like my old machine. The old one practically required ear plugs and scared my toddler. I can use this one in the kitchen while my baby is napping and not worry it will wake him up. Be careful or you may chop things more finely than you intend! It's fast. Also stores very neatly.
customer_reviews.author: Marie73

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I've been needing a larger food processor for a while, this one works really well
customer_reviews.author: Florida Gal

customer_reviews.title: Gift for wife
customer_reviews.text: Got as a gift for my wife. She is happy with the product and uses it often.
customer_reviews.author: Sr23

customer_reviews.title: Reach Reach Reach for the Hamilton Beach
customer_reviews.text: It's a great little food processor... well, not so little. 10 cups is a pretty good size, if you ask me. I mean, it's not enough for a restaurant operation, but if you're cooking for guests at home it's more than plenty. What else can I say about the Hamilton Beach that already hasn't been written before? It slices, dices, and even makes Julienne fries...whatever those are. Best part is, you can flip its lid so that it fits under your counter for easy storage. How AWESOME is that?
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Meola

customer_reviews.title: I'm giving this product five stars because it's easy to operate
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving this product five stars because it's easy to operate, take apart, clean, and store. As advertised the lid does flip into the cup so it takes less space to store. In addition I found it's sufficiently powerful that I just use the pulse option to shred my vegetables.
customer_reviews.author: serengetisam

customer_reviews.title: Just the right size
customer_reviews.text: Works good i make a lot of meat less tacos blends up the walnuts and cauliflower just perfectly
customer_reviews.author: Roland Plummer

customer_reviews.title: Very simplistic and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: It's exactly what I was looking for. Just the right size, capacity for my little kitchen adventures. Nice price too. Cuts my time and effort for making pies, salads, salsas...
customer_reviews.author: Nyx

customer_reviews.title: Great processor!
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed to make salsa! I placed all parts in the top rack of the dishwasher and they came out perfectly clean.
customer_reviews.author: Raedena Vogler

customer_reviews.title: Does the job well
customer_reviews.text: Powerful motor. I like to use it to grind my potatoes for kugel. It worked great!!
customer_reviews.author: shira orlowek

customer_reviews.title: Really a great processor for the price
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my mom's birthday and she loves it
customer_reviews.author: mrszee

customer_reviews.title: USED only twice.so far good
customer_reviews.text: So far like this proccessor. Did great job on salsa. Seems good quality. Easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Rock

customer_reviews.title: Great bargain. Very good service as well
customer_reviews.text: Great bargain. Very good service as well. Perfect size and great quality. Have used for finely chopping all the vegetables that go into Bolognese sauce. What a time saver. ,
customer_reviews.author: SKW

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Very strong motor. Nice design. Looks good in my kitchen. I would recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: gkot

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product for the price point! It has been perfect for everything I have made so far.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle B

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, clean, and store
customer_reviews.text: I love this processor. I also own a much more expensive Cuisinart and this one is hands down earlier to use, clean, and store, and it is only slightly less versatile. I find myself using it almost daily. The only thing I miss is the ability to knead dough, but I can do that in my Vitamix. Buy it without hesitation!
customer_reviews.author: M. Merryweather

customer_reviews.title: Does a great job
customer_reviews.text: It's very powerful and way better than the last one I had
customer_reviews.author: J9

customer_reviews.title: Excellent purchase. It is a real energy saving tool
customer_reviews.text: Excellent purchase. It is a real energy saving tool. I use it to grate coconut and carrots that usually take up time and I would be fine in less than five minutes. It's worth the price you would not regret it
customer_reviews.author: Rayne Caines

customer_reviews.title: Does the Job!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't expect too much because this is an inexpensive food processor. I was pleasantly surprised how quick it was chopping vegetable etc. The only minor fault I have with it, is that it doesn't stay as stationary as I would like it. I have to hold it steady. I would recommend thi.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry

customer_reviews.title: Like anything with plastic part
customer_reviews.text: I have now used this for over 4 years and it still works well. Like anything with plastic part, be careful.
customer_reviews.author: M. M.

customer_reviews.title: chute not wide enough
customer_reviews.text: i recently started canning and bought this to do chopping, shredding and slicing. but the chute is so narrow a cucumber will not even fit to slice. it does a fantastic job pureeing but the other functions are pretty much unless for what i needed them for. You have to cut cabbage up so small to get it in the chute you might as well shred it with a grater
customer_reviews.author: book maven

customer_reviews.title: Great food processor!
customer_reviews.text: It's so easy to use, easy to clean, and truly does what it's supposed to do! It's much easier than my blender!
customer_reviews.author: Tia

customer_reviews.title: Efficient
customer_reviews.text: We replaced an old Cuisinart and this one is bigger and more powerful. This is a great price and our early assessment is that it's been great.
customer_reviews.author: lpw

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! The motor doesn't slow down with large quantities. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: Christy G.

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: It works great and I have not had any problems with it
customer_reviews.author: MM

customer_reviews.title: simple but good
customer_reviews.text: If you need a machine with all the bells and whistles than don't buy this processor. If your looking for a machine that is simple to operate and easy to clean for occasional use in the kitchen that won't break the bank, than this is your machine.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hart

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: I'm glad that I ordered this food processor. It is powerful and works well. The first time that I used it on full speed, I had to hold the base down because it started to tip from the powerful motor. I then used it on pulse and it worked without holding it.
customer_reviews.author: Aletta

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME!!!
customer_reviews.text: Would give this ten stars!!! I was using a small processor for years and got tired of shredding and emptying over and over again. Went online and found this processor. I was skeptical as it wasn't expensive but figured it was worth a try. All I can say is BUY IT!!!!!!!!!!!!!! You will NOT be sorry. It's amazing. Best money ever spent.
customer_reviews.author: KA

customer_reviews.title: Impressed with  Hamilton Beach 10 Cup Food Processor
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed with this product. Previously had a Cuisinart food processor, but after 10+years it was time to be replaced. I was hesitant to go with another brand, but very happy I did. The 10cup bowl is a great size for my family of 6, and the motor is much quieter than my old Cuisinart's. It delivers on what the product promises (e.g., chop, mix, grate, shred), as well as being very easy to clean and store.
customer_reviews.author: nicole

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: Don't know how I lived so long without one... product was delivered slightly dented tho
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: It met my expectations, & does a good job. It is easy to clean, & stores in less space than most food processors.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Love the simplicity (on
customer_reviews.text: Love the simplicity (on, off, pulse..) Just made granola bar mixture with seeds, oats, etc. Worked flawlessly. Replaced 14cup ham beach "big mouth" food processor after 5yrs avg use. 10 cup is a good size for normal family of 4 cooking needs. Smaller foot print, plus this lid stores inside the bowl. Love it
customer_reviews.author: publicname

customer_reviews.title: ... this so much and for the price it works great. I love it
customer_reviews.text: I needed this so much and for the price it works great. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: A. Adderholt

customer_reviews.title: Great for everyday use
customer_reviews.text: This is a fabulous food processor. I use it for my dog food business daily. The blade stem is high which helps blend my recipes faster and smoother. The lid is molded in a way that it's easy to rinse between recipes. Other machines have several grooves and other nonsense which make the water splash up - not fun. This is the second model I have owned. The first lasted for more than 4 years, with daily use during the past 2 years. If you are a regular user or one that occasionally dabbles, this is the food processor for you!
customer_reviews.author: LJ Hennessy

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy “like new”. Definitely used
customer_reviews.text: I will never buy ”like new product again”. It is missing the shredding blade. Nice little dent on side too. I saved my old blades so u guess it’s not worth hassle of returning.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie Slavic

customer_reviews.title: great!
customer_reviews.text: I make my own cat food for 5 cats and this has cut my time from 6 hours to 2 1/2 . it's easy to use and easy to clean (I am using raw meats so cleaning it is high on my list) it's no louder than you would expect.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: and it's taken a lot of work out of making salads 'cause I hate the chopping
customer_reviews.text: I relied on the reviews; this is a compact, powerful and reliable unit, and it's taken a lot of work out of making salads 'cause I hate the chopping, etc. Multiple uses.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great machine for the price
customer_reviews.text: Used it twice, for cheese shredding and chopping nuts, did well on both. machine did not labor or jump around like some other machines. machine still new so we shall see.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Geer

customer_reviews.title: Great buy.
customer_reviews.text: Compact and powerful. Simple to use and easy dishwasher clean up.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Perez

customer_reviews.title: Very cost effective food processor
customer_reviews.text: She really likes this. It's a very cost effective food processor. Only time will tell about the longevity.
customer_reviews.author: ConcreteGuy

product_meta.title: Hamilton Beach 10-Cup Food Processor & Vegetable Chopper with Compact Storage (70760)
product_meta.description: Prepare an endless variety of food fast. Chop onions, mix sauces, grate cheese, shred cabbage, prepare pesto, or slice salad ingredients in seconds. Lets you process Large batches, but just as easily, chop a few nuts. Large feed tube fits a whole block of cheese. Reversible slice/shred discs and chopping blade are included. Bowl, lid, chopping blade and reversible slice/shred disc are dishwasher safe. Lid flips over for compact storage to save cabinet space. Cord storage area.
feature_bullets: Chop onions, mix sauces, grate cheese, shred cabbage, prepare pesto or slice salad ingredients in seconds
Large feed tube fits a whole block of cheese
Reversible slice and shred discs and chopping blade are included
Lid flips over for compact storage to save cabinet space

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars926 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
